What about anime-fiction.net?  Anyone know anything pro or con about 
them?  (I've had the link, but just haven't gotten around to checking 
around the site.)

BTW, I need some clarification... Exactly what is chat and keyboard 
dialogue?

phil (whose account may finally be behaving again...)

--- In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, Barbara Sheridan 
<bsher213@b...> wrote:
> Firuze wrote:
> 
> I think I might as well rant a bit, and while I'm at it, give a 
warning to my fellow authors...  I found this little 'pearl' in the 
main page of ff net today:
> 
>  April 19th, 2004 -- Please note that FanFiction.Net's content 
guidelines apply to the entire story. For example, if you have chat 
or keyboard dialogue in author notes but not the story, the entire 
story will be considered for removal. To sum it up, everything you 
upload is subject to the content guidelines and TOS. 
> 
> Where is  the 'Unleash your imagination' thingy went?  first they 
forbade the NC 17, then they external links to our NC17 chapters 
(which of course can be circumvent with little effort, btw) and/or 
recourses about history or culture related to our stories, later the 
Author Notes as separate chapters, and now this. Next time, what? Is  
just me or I detect a more and more repressive trend here? I mean, I 
don't write such kind of things in the Author's notes, but they have 
to control EVERYTHING we decide to express?>>
> 
> 
> I agree that the earlier NC 17 purge was unfair but I'm wondering 
if 
> this and the other recent thing about getting rid of poetry--
certain 
> poetry---whatever is more a way of trying to save space/bandwidth. 
I 
> have a feeling they got a hell of a lot bigger than they first 
imagined 
> and it's costing them more than they want to spend to have the 
equipment 
> and such to handle the traffic so they're going to cut every corner 
they 
> possibly can as long as they have some "viable" reason for it.
> 
> 
> 
> <<I'm SOOOOOO fed up with them. It's a real pity that Media Miner 
hadn't gotten more popular, because this place sucks more and more 
with each passing day. >.<
> 
> Well, so you are warned, beware of FF net new adding to their 
censor's scissors. They are out there just for you.
> 
> Firuze>>
> 
> I have some stuff on Media Miner but it's such a PITA for me. It 
never 
> seems to work right and changing a password is a major adventure. 
> Adultff.net is even more of a pain because you have to jump through 
> multiple hoops to get anything to upload properly.
> 
> 
> -- 
> Barbara Sheridan
> http://www.barbarasheridan.net
